name: Football At The Movies Online Trivia | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which comedic great starred in the 1925 classic 'The Freshman'?
questions.explanation:
Harold Lloyd.

	The film, which was called 'College Days' in the UK, describes a hapless college student's attempts to make the football team.

questions.text: 'Pigskin Parade', a 1936 musical comedy about a football team, marked the feature film debut of which Hollywood great?
questions.explanation:
Judy Garland.

	The movie also featured a pre-stardom Betty Grable.

questions.text: The 1940 film 'Knute Rockne-All American' portrayed the life of one of the most famous and most loved football coaches. Which team did he coach?
questions.explanation:
Notre Dame.

	The movie also starred Ronald Reagan as George Gipp, and he uttered the famous line, 'win one for the Gipper'.

questions.text: John Derek starred in the 1951 film 'Saturday's Hero'. Who played his girlfriend?
questions.explanation:
Donna Reed.

	This movie, directed by David Miller, examines the dark side of college football.

questions.text: Which 1968 film described Alan Alda's attempts to write an article for 'Sports Illustrated' by posing as a quarterback?
questions.explanation:
Paper Lion.

	The movie is based on the non-fiction book by George Plimpton. Alda plays Plimpton. Quite a few Detroit Lions players make appearances.

questions.text: Which club did the subjects of the classic 1971 film 'Brian's Song' play for?
questions.explanation:
Chicago Bears.

	This made for tv movie describes the friendship between Brian Piccolo and Gale Sayers, and Piccolo's battle with cancer.

questions.text: Who starred in the 1974 prison-football movie, 'The Longest Yard'?
questions.explanation:
Burt Reynolds and Eddie Albert.

	'The Longest Yard' was directed by Robert Aldrich, and also featured Ed Lauter and Michael Conrad.

questions.text: What is the title of the 1978 film in which a wrongfully-killed Los Angeles Rams quarterback, comes back to life in the body of a recently murdered millionaire?
questions.explanation:
Heaven Can Wait.

	This comedy-fantasy starred Warren Beatty, Julie Christie and James Mason.

questions.text: Who starred as an ex-football player in 1984's 'Against All Odds'?
questions.explanation:
Jeff Bridges.

	The film co-starred Rachel Ward and featured James Woods and Richard Widmark.

questions.text: This 1986 Robin Williams and Kurt Russell effort tells the story of a small town loser who is determined to have one more shot at the big time by winning a football game. What is the film called?
questions.explanation:
The Best of Times.

	'All the Right Moves' is a Tom Cruise film, 'Horse Feathers' is a Marx Brothers film and 1969's 'Number One' is a Charlton Heston film.
